Text_Numeracy:
This question is asking what experience I have personally have in the health or medical field. Here is an example of an experience that I had: 

I was experiencing some major abdominal pain and so my mom rushed me to the ER. I was in a lot of pain so the doctor ordered blood work results which indicated that my white blood cell count was really high. This implied that I had some kind of infection. The doctor then put me on a throughout bout of antibiotics, took more blood tests and then when the results came back, it was determined that I had C. diff. (meaning clostrodium tough). This is a bacteria that can be in the hospital or even in some public restrooms (which is their breeding ground). C. diff is an ever changing bacteria because of its mutating DNA. My doctor stressed the importance of washing my hands often, washing thoroughly for more than 20 seconds and to not take antibiotics like its candy because this will be the event for recurrent cases of C. diff. I was then discharged, prescribed antibiotics and continued with them for two weeks and made a full recovery.
